intro: Plectaneia breviloba, commonly known as the short-lobed plectane, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
